channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 large potholes, 5th February
item.description:
2 large pot holes on Highbury corner just past the traffic lights on Canonbury Road. Been there a few days. Good luck!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highbury Corner, Highbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous deep pothole, 5th February
item.description:
This is a very deep pothole and presents an immediate and serious danger to all road users, including pedestrians, cyclists, and motorists. I was forced to swerve suddenly to avoid it and narrowly missed colliding with a cyclist. This section of road is already a known pinch point due to the segregation on the left. Being required to swerve to the right to avoid the pothole creates confusion for other road users and significantly increases the risk of a serious collision. If not addressed urgently, this defect could result in a serious accident or fatality

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in carlton road, 5th February
item.description:
A resident has reported that there is a wardrobe thats been dumped on carlton road in junction of silver spring close on the grass area. This is a common thing that happens here and residents would like a sign or something done about this please. Also there is lots of rubbish at the back of garages in thorne close, we are not sure if this is a bulky collection so may want to check this first?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carlton Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old mattress/woodend pannels and Dog poo dumpted by the bin stores bin stores, 5th February
item.description:
This is a Business Centre, our location is on the corner of Webber Row,we have a car park, our bins are stored there. We have constant dumping of various items. In the past we have had to pay to have the items removed. Can anything be done about this?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 195-203, Waterloo Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
